page.title: 04Edingale Church Its History
page.content: Edingale church began as a chapelry of Alrewas and the great tithes were given to the clergy of Lichfield Cathedral.In the early days there may have been two chapels since the county boundary then divided the village.There was no mention of the church in the Domesday Survey 1086 but this proves nothing since William didn't ask for ecclesiastical buildings to be counted.The first mention of a chapel at Edingale seems to be 1191 when the chapel was confirmed to the See of Lichfield. About the year 1159 the vicar of Alrewas had a house in Edingale and from medieval times the parish was served by a curate.
